question: A 45-year-old man complains of a severe, constant headache for the past 2 days. He is noted on physical examination to have papilledema on the right. He becomes obtunded. The representative gross pathologic appearance of a complication in this man is shown here. Which of the following conditions is most likely to produce this gross finding? <image 1>
description: The image shows a cross-sectional view of a brain with significant pathology. The brain appears to have a large, irregularly shaped lesion with a dark, necrotic center surrounded by a lighter, more solid area. The lesion is expansive and has caused significant distortion of the surrounding brain tissue. The size of the lesion is indicated by a metric ruler placed next to the brain, which measures approximately 5 centimeters in diameter. The overall appearance suggests a highly invasive and destructive process within the brain.
